commitResults.messageTitle: Renamed bot name and did initial skeleton
commitResults.messageBody: Changed my bot name to GiChat and did the initial skeleton for the code as per requested
Added scanner to scan for user input and check if user says bye or not
added addTask() and listTasks() to add tasks and list the tasks, then also created an arraylist to track the tasks added using addTask, and also allow listTasks to display the task as intended

commitResults.messageTitle: created Task class and edited GiChat array
commitResults.messageBody: created task class and fixed array list for the bot so instead of having an array list of strings it became an array list of tasks

commitResults.messageTitle: Added logic for receiving mark and unmark commands
commitResults.messageBody: split the input into two parts, first will be the command then the bot will know whether or not to mark the task, list out tasks or just add tasks like normal, change the way the bot speak too
allow users to mark and unmark their task in the list

commitResults.messageTitle: created classes for the different Tasks
commitResults.messageBody: created the 3 different classes for the 3 different tasks and made them inherit from Task classs
created 3 methods for each task and edited the syntax for the deadline and evnet toString, works nicely but still need to handle error and some edge cases

If user were to use mark and give a non integer value, it would be handled right now, also most of the error handling have already been identified as i was typing it out, still have that need to watch out for though
Added an error handling where if users were to mark an already marked task or if user unmark and unmarked task, it would let the user know
added and tested delete feature, works great, similar to markTask
